fields.description:
I am using Sourcetree with Git, for Framemaker files, which are binary files.  Framemaker is a desktop publishing software for technical writers. We have a "book" file which groups multiple individual Framemaker files together (each of which represents a chapter in the book). Framemaker has a function where you can change some attribute of all of chapters in a book, such as changing the conditions in all the chapters, or updating the page numbering in all of the chapters, or clearing the change bars in all of the chapters. When performing some of these "group" actions, each chapter is opened quickly, changed, and then saved again. During this process I get an error message that one of the chapters could not be saved. When I look at the File Status in SourceTree, it shows as a Removed/Deleted file in the Unstaged Files section. I then have to Discard the deletiong and re-do the group action. When I redo the group action, a different file will then get deleted, and so on, over and over again.

This is not specific to my laptop - there are 5 writers in our group, and it happens to all of us.

This does appear to be specific to either SourceTree or Git, because this only started happening once we started using SourceTree and Git (our files were previously in a Subversion, and we never had this issue).

If I move the book and all its chapters OUTSIDE of the Git directory/Sourcetree, and do the same group action, it works fine. 

I updated to the latest version of Sourcetree (3.4.5), because I noticed in the release notes that there was a fix for an issue that SORT of sounded like it might have something to do with this ("Fixed staging modified files with paths longer than 260 characters stages the file as 'Removed'), but updating did not resolve the problem. Also, I checked my file paths, and none are longer than 100 characters.
fields.summary: Files deleted after performing update of multiple files

fields.description:
If a new repository tab is added with the "Add repository" option using a path with duplicated slashes like this one:
C:\\MyFolder\\MyRepo
The repository will be added (as expected), but then the open in "Explorer" button will fail to open the right folder and it will just open the default FileExplorer path.

It is common to find paths with duplicated slashes because thats how it is stored in json files, and windows is usually able to normalize the slashes to make things work.
Normalizing is just removing duplicated slashes with just a few exceptions like UNC paths at the begining of the path:
\\servername\mySharedFolder\myRepo

SourceTree should be able to open the "Explorer" in any case, other functionality might be having the same normalization problems if they operate with the repo path.
fields.summary: Add repository by path doesn't normalize slashes making "Open in Explorer" not to work

fields.description:
A modal dialog asking me if I want to download git-lfs files got stuck behind the main SourceTree window. 

Unfortunately, this dialog is so modal that it prevented me from resizing the main window, prevented me from minimizing it, prevented me from using the [Windows key + arrow keys] shortcuts, and prevented me from closing the program with the upper-right hand corner "X" button.

Affects the latest version (3.4.5.0)

 

*Workaround*:  I had 2 screens in "extend these displays" mode.  When I changed them to "duplicate these displays", the dialog re-appeared over the main SourceTree window and I was able to resolve the problem.  

If you don't happen to have 2 monitors in extend mode when this problem happens, then you're just screwed.
fields.summary: Modal dialog gets stuck behind main window, making program unusable

fields.description:
Opening modal popup dialogs like "Jump to Commit" should set focus the required text input.



A proper user experience would be to be able to click on "Jump to" >> "commit.."
and without having to manually click on the text input, it should have focus the moment the dialog gets open, so I can paste the id from my clipboard with Control + V and then clicking on ENTER key should go to that commit (as if I clicked on OK).

 

The current experience is that I have to click on the text input before I can paste, because after that dialog opens, the focus element is the "OK" button which is worthless without filling the textbox, and pressing tab or shift+tab doesn't iterate through the required input for some reason as it should .
fields.summary: Opening modal popup dialogs like "Jump to Commit" should set focus the required text input

fields.description:
Jump to commit by commit Id doesn't work with upper-case commit Ids.

 When jumping to a specific commit in SourceTree, if you had copy the commit Id from other tool or automated process that provides it in Upper case, SourceTree will not find the commit.

 

SourceTree should be able to jump to a commit id regardless of the casing.
fields.summary: Jump to commit by commit Id doesn't work with upper-case commit Ids

fields.description:
I'm having a problem where I can't seem to get Sourcetree to start beyond the blue splashscreen/banner. After a few seconds the splashscreen disappears and the program has not started.

OS: Windows 10
Sourcetree is shown as an app
When Sourcetree is started, only the splashscreen is shown
After this, Sourcetree does not show in task manager (processes, services, app history)

I have tried uninstalling, deleting %localappdata% folders and even searched and deleted some registry keys. Also restarting before and after uninstalling/installing.

I have tried installing 3.3.8, 3.4.1, 3.4.2, 3.4.4 and 3.4.5 via the EXE and MSI installers in both %localappdata% and Program Files (x86).

I have used Sourcetree for several years now and I need it for work. Any help would be greatly appriciated!
fields.summary: Sourcetree will not start beyond splash screen

fields.description:
This seems to be a recurring issue in Source Tree without a proper resolution.

!image-2021-06-22-10-59-53-603.png!

As I already have a later Git version on the machine 

!image-2021-06-22-11-01-36-749.png!
fields.summary: Gitflow Not Supported

fields.description:
I have a repo with Git LFS enabled for some file types. With the file locking option *disabled*, large files can be added to the index with no issues. When the file locking option is *enabled*, files larger than 2 MB cannot be added to the index, since I get an error popup prompting me to track the files with LFS (when in fact the file extension is already being tracked).

Steps to reproduce:

1) Create an empty git repo

2) git lfs install

3) Add and commit the following .gitattributes file:


{color:#d4d4d4}*.uasset {color}{color:#569cd6}filter{color}{color:#d4d4d4}=lfs {color}{color:#569cd6}diff{color}{color:#d4d4d4}=lfs {color}{color:#569cd6}merge{color}{color:#d4d4d4}=lfs -text lockable{color}
 

4) Add .uasset a file larger than 2 MB to the index

5) Get the following error

!image-2021-06-21-19-29-01-601.png!
fields.summary: Git LFS not working when file locking option is set

fields.description:
I'm using SourceTree 3.4.5.0 and my settings/options does not reflect on next open. 

For example. theme preference, SSH configuration in "Tools->Options" and previously opened repositories are either not saved or not reflect when I open the next time after closing SourceTree. 

I checked the version. It says update-to-date in Settings. Couldn't find any article/help around this.
fields.summary: SourceTree - Settings/Preferences not saved

fields.description:
SourceTree has a feature that will search the repository root for a file named "icon.png" and if it exist it will use it as an icon in SourceTree UI.

This is a great feature that we enjoy and use, however the SourceTree for Windows app keeps a hard reference to that "icon.png" file that prevents the user or git to delete it.

 

This becomes a problem if the user want's to checkout another branch in which the "icon.png" doesn't exist, because the file will still be there as a pending change that the user won't be able to remove unless closing SourceTree first (not very intuitive).
Trying to discard the change (of the added "icon.png") from SourceTree will just fail and not remove it.
Windows File Explorer will alert the user that the file cannot be removed if SourceTree is running.

 

Maybe SourceTree could make a copy of the repo's "icon.png" so the reference is to the copy and it doesn't block the original image, or any other strategy to allow image removal.
fields.summary: Make SourceTree reference the in-repo "icon.png" in a way that allows deleting the file

fields.description:
When in *Options/Diff*

- Convert tabs to space is *unset* and
- Show whitespace characters is *set*

"Tab" characters and "Space" characters are displayed incorrectly. Please note that the actual diff text and indentations are unaffected, and displayed at the correct indentation level.

!image-2021-06-17-17-12-20-010.png!
fields.summary: Spaces and tabs in diff views are displayed in the wrong position

fields.description:
Error occurred when I try to reverse merge commit. Full output:
{code:java}
git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks revert --no-edit fcb73b96c2a11714e69e64cda45aaff27c90e304
error: commit fcb73b96c2a11714e69e64cda45aaff27c90e304 is a merge but no -m option was given.
fatal: revert failed
Completed with errors, see above.{code}
Revert command must be provided with required -m parent-number parameter (number of merge side). Passing -m 1 completely solve the problem
fields.summary: Failed to reverse merge commit

fields.description:
When cloning a repository from Bitbucket, it fails to "activate" the clone button and just crashes the app.

 

I enter the Source Path/URL, the destination path, then as it's loading/validating it crashes before I can click "Clone."

 

!image-2021-06-15-07-59-34-719.png!

fields.description:
I keep getting error with AskPass.exe, usually at least three times per day. The error is basically just a popup windows, that interrupts my work, even while in meetings. When one of the AskPass.exe errors happen, usually there are several more in quick succession.

This issue is pretty well documented in this thread, as other users experience this as well. 
https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Askpass-exe-application-error/qaq-p/1312523
Unfortunately, the fixes proposed in this thread did not work.

Though I really like Sourcetree's UI, this issue is seriously making me consider switching myself and my team to another app, as my colleagues are having this error as well. Please, fix it, as soon as possible.
fields.summary: AskPass.exe error

fields.description:
Seems to be the same as https://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-8417 but I'm getting this on version 3.4.2.

Repro steps:
 1. Tools -> Options
 2. Change to Diff tab
 3. Click Change Font
 4. Change size from 11 to 12
 5. Click OK on Choose Font dialog

latest pageant is at version 0.75 and a lot of security bug has been fixed since version 0.70

fields.description:
After updating from a previous version (probably 3.4.4) to 3.4.5 as soon as I was offered the update today, wslgit (https://github.com/andy-5/wslgit/) no longer works with sourcetree.

Attempting to change from embedded to system git in options > git appears to do nothing; the shown file path does not change from the embedded path, the system button remains enabled and the embedded button remains disabled. No error message is shown. Clicking the system button again does nothing but briefly flash a throbber.

Without the ability to use this system git, I cannot use any repository stored on WSL2, ie all of my repositories. Effectively, this bug wholly prevents me from using sourcetree.
fields.summary: After updating, system git no longer works with sourcetree

fields.description:
Details are written here with images(in Japanese).
https://note.com/jp011100/n/nddf2abbd9981
https://note.com/jp011100/n/n99407fb189b9

On the screen to write the commit log,
I should be able to
- type in Japanese,
- press the space bar to select a candidate for Kanji,
- and then continue to type in the punctuation.

Although the punctuation appears for a moment, it disappears.
This happens at any version of Sourcetree (2.6.10 - 3.4.4).

This is caused by new version IME.
Older version IME has no problem.

Thank you for reading.

Below text is same message in Japanese.

----------------------------------------------------------
詳細はこちらに日本語で画像入りで書いてあります。
https://note.com/jp011100/n/nddf2abbd9981
https://note.com/jp011100/n/n99407fb189b9

コミットログを書く画面で、
日本語を入力して、スペースキーを押して、漢字の候補を選択した後、
続けて句点を入力できるはずですが、
句点が一瞬表示されるものの、消えてしまいます。
これは、SourceTreeのどのバージョンでも起きます (2.6.10 - 3.4.4)。

新しいバージョンのIMEで起きてます。
「以前のバージョンのIME」だと問題ありません。

よろしくお願いいたします。
fields.summary: Commit log textbox problem with new version IME for Japanese

fields.description:
I have generated a private and public key with the most current version 0.75 of puttyGen.
Bitbucked accepts well the public key.
However when I assign this private key to Sourcetree, then I get the error message:

*Couldnt' load private key (PuTTY key format too new).*
fields.summary: support new format of PuttyGen Release 0.75

fields.description:
Cliking on the Explorer button or selecting the Show in explorer menu opens the folder for the working copy.

But is the folder is already open pressing again on the button opens another instance of the folder, instead of bringing up the folder.
fields.summary: Show in Explorer reopens existing folder

fields.description:
Hello,
I can't login in Sourcetree, I can't pull with terminal, haven't changed a thing, on last Friday(28.05) everything was working. However I can login into Bitbucket via browser.
I have reset my password and searched issues but with no success.
Here is error I got:
!image-2021-05-31-09-54-17-023.png!
fields.summary: Failed to check login for user

fields.description:
I have configured my remote's push refspec for remote 'user' to push to refs/users/myusername/heads/* such that `git push user` sends my modification to my userspace on my gerrit server.

It all works well from the command line, but SourceTree doesn't let me use the default push refspec. It always overrides the target branch with a value, doesn't let me push without a defined target branch and makes it increadibly hard for me to actually find out what it actually does.

A solution is obviously a custom button but SourceTree should really honor the push refspec config.
fields.summary: Push refspec not honored

fields.description:
(I am not very good at English, so I apologize in advance.)

When you try to "git flow finish feature" a Feature branch based on the Support branch, the branch shown in the Preview of the "Finish Feature dialog" is "develop".

Example:
 # You have a tag of v0.0.2 on your master branch.
 # Run "git flow support v0.0.2 v0.0.2" in a terminal.
 # Using the gitflow GUI, start the v0.0.2.1 feature based on support/v0.0.2.
 # Commit any changes to the feature v0.0.2.1.
 # Try to complete the feature v0.0.2.1 using the gitflow GUI.

Expected behavior:
 The branch shown in the Preview of the "Finish Feature dialog" will be "support/v0.0.2".

Actual behavior:
 The branch that appears in the Preview of the "Finish Feature dialog" will be "develop".

Additional information:
 The actual merge destination will be "support/v0.0.2", which is consistent with the expected behavior.
 I think it's just that the branch shown in the dialog is wrong.
In the config file, the base contains the original branch name when the branch was created using gitflow.
It looks like you need to read that and display it.
{code:bash}
[gitflow "branch.feature/v0.0.2.1"]
	base = support/v0.0.2
{code}
fields.summary: Bug in the display when doing the "git flow finish feature".

fields.description:
When checking out a remote branch to a new local branch, the local branch does not appear in the push dialog after changes have been committed.

  !image-2021-05-20-16-56-11-015.png!

I have no open GitHub repos (only one which is Bitbucket) and I have no GitHub accounts registered in the system:

!image-2021-05-20-13-45-23-415.png!

 

But Sourcetree keeps asking:

!image-2021-05-20-13-47-57-574.png!
fields.summary: Sourcetree constantly asks for GitHub credentials

fields.description:
Independently of {{.gitignore}}, in the diff tab of the options menu, sourcetree has a setting to exclude certain file patterns from showing a diff. These files still appear in the staged/unstaged files list, but selecting them will not show a preview, the same as if the file were excluded for being eg too large in size. However, this option does not work when the file is untracked.

Steps to reproduce:
 # Create a very large text file and name it {{dump.sql}}
 # Open the sourcetree options, go to the diff tab and add {{,*dump.sql}} to the ignore file patterns list.
 # Save the options and restart sourcetree to ensure they take effect.
 # Reopen sourcetree and select {{dump.sql}} from the unstaged files list. The full file will be loaded.
 # Stage {{dump.sql}}.
 # Select {{dump.sql}} from the staged files list. The following message will appear: "No changes in this file have been detected, or it is a binary file or it is configured to be ignored by the File patterns".

Expected behaviour:

At step 4, the full file is not loaded, and instead the same message from step 6 is displayed.
fields.summary: Ignore file patterns diff option does not work for untracked files

fields.description:
It's Windows native UI behavior that focused buttons get clicked by the keyboard space key

Please respect the native standards
fields.summary: Can't activate focused button with the space key
Unable to remove submodules that located at folder which contains space

fields.description:
When listing Tracked Branches for a Push to Origin, SourceTree doesn't list branches that contains the underscore character '_'.

Example,

for a branch say with a name 'Feature_Changes' this branch will not be listed under 'Branches to Push' in the Push to Origin pop-up dialog.

if the branch were to be renamed to 'Feature-Changes' this branch will now show under 'Branches to Push' in the Push Origin pop-up dialog.
fields.summary: SourceTree doesn't list local branches with underscore '_' as Tracked

fields.description:
Hi folks,

recently I noticed a problem with a git bash just right after I had upgraded git-scm from version 2.24.0.2 to 2.31.1.

Message from the log is: "ERROR [2021-05-17 15:20:54,842] [1] [SourceTree.Repo.RepoHandlerGitOld] [Log] - UNable to bash start process for 'F:\engine'"

I use system git. With embedded git terminal works fine.
"Use Git Bash as default terminal" in "Tools->Options->Git" is enabled.

fields.description: When I open source tree, then within seconds the source tree gets closed. I've tried cloning it via Bitbucket but same thing happens.

fields.description:
I use Sourcetree for Windows in combination with WSL 2 for web coding. 

When I create a fresh clone from Github on WSL, and add the clone to Sourcetree using `wsl$\\Ubuntu-20.01\path\to\my\code`, sometimes 1-2 files that are marked as changed.
 - Vscode, however does not see any changes

 - When I discard the changes in Sourcetree, it remains being marked as changed. 
Vscode however does see a change now. The change is that the execute permission has been removed from the file.
fields.summary: Sourcetree sees changes after fresh "git clone" on WSL

Click Commit.

Then, Tools > Options > General > Default user information, I change the name and/or Email address details.

The author field above the commit message does not update. This is when the repository is set to use the global author details.

Changed files do not show up for stage.

git -c diff.mnemonicprefix=false -c core.quotepath=false --no-optional-locks fetch origin
fatal: HttpRequestException encountered.
 An error occurred while sending the request.

remote: Too many invalid password attempts. Log in at https://id.atlassian.com/ to restore access.

Completed with errors, see above.

fields.description:
When I stage Keil project files in "staged files" they disappear and don't get included in the push.  I reviewed my gitignore, uninstalled 3.3.8 and re-installed 3.4 clean.  I created a new clean Jira and the same thing happens.  What do I need to do to get my Keil *.uvproj to work / re-appear / push?  I seem to waste more and more time fighting with SourceTree, at least I don't crash every time I clone a new repo with 3.4.  How can a 3.x release have such a fundamental mistake?  Why didn't 3.3.8  say there is a new release?  I had to go to the web site to find it.

My core issue is my uvproj files disappear in "staged files".  Please help me fix this...
fields.summary: Files disappear in "staged files"

fields.description:
Is possible to have a feature that say me the name of branch also when I don't see the branch tag? like in the screenshot example?

!image-2021-04-29-17-45-49-372.png!
fields.summary: Name of branch on hover in History Tab

fields.description:
This bug has existed in every 3.x version of Sourcetree for Windows (currently still present in 3.4.4) and is easily replicated.
 # Create a repository
 # Edit the config and add `worktree = C:\\Some\\Path` where that path is not the repository directory.
 # Create a file in this new main working tree directory
 # SourceTree sees the new file, but cannot stage it (produces an error)
 # Stage the file with the terminal and commit with either the terminal or SourceTree
 # Change the file
 # SoucreTree sees the change as an edit
 # Stage the file with SourceTree
 # It is staged as a file deletion and the actual file in the working tree is DELETED, along with any changes you were attempting to stage

Deleting files people are trying to enter into version control is a cardinal sin level of bug and this will be my 3rd time submitting over the past 3 years.
fields.summary: Staging files deletes them instead if main working tree is not in default location.
SourceTree crashes on startup for multi-user / RDP environments

fields.description:
In your History Tree when you show all the  revisions.

I work on a massive project with over 50 developers and it would be so so nice if that control was replaced with one where I could  filter by  column so I could say only show me my changes

I know replacing controls is none trivial so how about next to "Show Remote Branches" there is "Show only my changes" 

"Hide Merge Pull"

 etc

 

That would just focus on my changes, whereas  at the moment , i have to scroll and scroll  etc.

 

Thanks so much

 

ps where is sourcetree not a component when filling in this form?
fields.summary: Filter History by user

fields.description:
I have installed putty and pageant outside of Sourcetree, and I have Pageant startup during OS boot so my key-file is always ready.

Didn't quite notice it at first, so not sure which version it started at, but Sourcetree now causes Pageant to crash/close when it opens or closes, causing e.g. git commands and such from command line to suddenly start to failing for no apparent reason.

Whenever I open or close Sourcetree now, I have to reopen Pageant and reload my key, including entering a long passkey. Super annoying. Sourcetree shouldn't close or cause any other applications to crash when it opens or when it closes.

It happens on all 3 computers of mine. All running latest Windows, latest Pageant, and latest Sourcetree.
fields.summary: Opening and closing Sourcetree causes Pageant to crash/close

fields.description: Even though source tree is installed fine on the machine and there are no other issues or errors of the WMI, user keeps getting message that source tree has stopped working, when launching source tree and hence not able to resolve issue. Tried reinstallation but still issue exists.
fields.summary: SourceTree not working

fields.description:
*{color:#172b4d}Summary:{color}*

 

{color:#172b4d}When I try and Rebase Interactively and I have 5 commits. After Squashing With Previous, the last commit, doesn’t get squashed. Please see this SO question for more details:{color}

{color:#172b4d}[{color:#0052cc}https://stackoverflow.com/questions/42221088/how-to-properly-squash-commits-using-sourcetree{color}]{color}

*Detail:*

We're using Git as our source control system, and I like to commit my code on a regular basis. This does mean that when I'm ready to push to the shared repo I've created quite a few nonsense commits that I'd like to squash away before pushing.

Using SourceTree that should be a simple thing, but I keep running into issues where not all selected commits are being squashed together. Let me show some images of what I do using a sample repo with some checkins:

!https://i.imgur.com/A4HpALJ.png!

I click the first checking and choose to 'rebase children interactively'

!https://i.imgur.com/lkPphjS.png!

A pop will appear with all the checkins:

!https://i.imgur.com/0yCPcNm.png!

On this popup I click the 'fifth' checkin and hit the squash with previous 3 times until the screen looks like this:

!https://i.imgur.com/HH7zIR3.png!

All's fine you'd think, but then when hitting the 'ok' button, this is what I end up with:

!https://i.imgur.com/KSr1A32.png!

Why oh why does it not include the 'Second' commit in the end result? Judging by the looks of the popup you'd think this is included as well. I can do the same thing again to get the second in there, but I just can't fathom why it works this way or how to squash them all in one go:
fields.summary: Squashing With Previous ignores the last item in the list

fields.description:
When I create a branch with the first hierarchy, the branch is created but it does not appear on the screen
It doesn't appear on the branch delete screen
fields.summary: make branch first time not show

fields.description: When I cancel backgound refresh in settings, the mouse can response again.
fields.summary: Backgroud refresh task cause mouse no response

fields.description:
Steps to reproduce:
 * {{git add SomeNewFile}} # might by invoked by adding a file in an IDE (e.g. Qt Creator), or command line
 * do some modifications to {{SomeNewFile}}
 * => {{SomeNewFile}} doesn't show up in the Pending or Modified filters, only in the Clean/All ones

{{git status}} - shows the file as "new file" besides the "modified" ones in the Changes sections and the file will be included by {{git add -u}} (that should be the pending filter)

I think Sourcetree behavior to exclude the file completely from Pending view is wrong. Pending showing the untracked files but not the ones added and modified is very confusing, the file being in a more "pending" state than untracked ones (see {{add -u}}).

LE: Windows 10, Sourcetree 3.4.4, git 2.30
fields.summary: Pending filter in File Status view does not show newly added and modified files

Currently I don't have any repositories in github - all are in bitbucket and I use for all repositories a bitbucket alias and account to login. The annoying problem i have is that I receive regularily the request to authenticate on github.com. Apart from that there is no other impact. I followed some older advice to use system git instead of embedded, cleared config settings. makes no difference. git pull on any repository works fine.

Sourcetree v3.4.3 on Windows 10

System Git version 2.29.2

I just re-installed Sourcetree on my new computer this week and used latest version 3.4.3. 
I was not facing the same behavior on my previous computer. Unfortunatelly I cannot say which version it was, but it was a 'quite' recent one (probably less than 6 months).

 

_PS: 3.4.3 version is not available in the version list, so I put 3.4.3-beta_

Windows 10 Pro

fields.description:
Hi!

Please could you add [WinMerge|https://winmerge.org/] to the merge tool selection as it has supported 3-way merge since [early 2018|https://github.com/WinMerge/winmerge/blob/master/Docs/Users/ChangeLog.md#winmerge-2152---2018-01-28]? Thank you! 
h3. Current situation (Tested on Sourcetree 3.4.3 Windows 64-bit):

WinMerge is not available in the "Options > Diff > External Diff / Merge > Merge Tool" dropdown box.
h3. Desired outcome:

WinMerge is available in the "Options > Diff > External Diff / Merge > Merge Tool" dropdown box and merging using it works.

 
----
h3. Background / related issues:
h4. Related bug:

The bug SRCTREEWIN-4572 ("Can't select WinMerge as merge tool") from 2016 was closed because WinMerge didn't yet support a 3-way merge. But as of 2018-01-28 WinMerge has supported 3-way merge (See WinMerge [2.15.2 changelog|https://github.com/WinMerge/winmerge/blob/master/Docs/Users/ChangeLog.md#winmerge-2152---2018-01-28] from 2018-01-28: "Add support for 3-way compare/merge"). I tried today (2021-03-08) using WinMerge 3-way merge with the custom merge option using the information from this [Sourcetree Community question|https://community.atlassian.com/t5/Sourcetree-questions/Can-t-launch-external-merge-tool-WinMerge-on-Windows/qaq-p/315156] and it worked okay.
h4. Currently working custom merge options for WinMerge:

The options I used in Sourcetree 3.4.3 for Windows 64-bit with WinMerge 2.16.10.0 x64 and which worked for merging:
 * Options > Diff > External Diff / Merge:
 ** Merge Tool: Custom
 ** Merge Command: C:\Program Files\WinMerge\WinMergeU.exe
 *** Arguments:
{noformat}
-wl -wr -dl Remote -dm Base -dr Local \"$REMOTE\" \"$BASE\" \"$LOCAL\" -o \"$MERGED\"{noformat}
fields.summary: Adding WinMerge to merge tool selection

fields.description:
Being prompted to "Run 'git lfs pull' now?" despite all lfs files up to date when open a tab to a repository.

Looks like the implementation of RepoHandlerGitOld.NeedsLargeFilesPull has been not quite right for a while.

According to the lfs [source|https://github.com/git-lfs/git-lfs/blob/2e1d981afbe33bd6b9bebb9943daf236636e5e33/commands/command_ls_files.go#L149] for the output, *ALL* files will be output.
 Those that exist and are the same size will be annotated with a '*', those that don't with a '-'.

{{701ab1713a2cacb797738ab5220a5ed640f1c38affb71e83cc6ac9bd53c35d13 - deletedfile.txt}}
 {{a6c2fde49d61d6226446ff0fb3d78db15ebae71da9fb505e17a32a1cb4f93ac4 * intactfile.txt}}



Currently, SourceTree will prompt if the *first* line matches  "[0-9a-fA-F]\{64} . .+", which is always.

 

Proposed fix:

Change the regex to search for "[0-9a-fA-F]\{64} *-* .+" (changing the first dot to a minus) so that it only looks for files reported by LFS that need to be updated.

 

The reason that 3.4.1 doesn't have this issue, is that the *first* file will be investigated for a string that contains "git-lfs.github.com".

 

Related to #[13418|http://jira.atlassian.com/browse/SRCTREEWIN-13418]
fields.summary: RepoHandlerGitOld.NeedsLargeFilesPull incorrectly returning true for files reported unchanged by LFS

2) push the "remote" Icon on the top of the Tab menu

fields.description:
The branch tree on the left shows a tree according to branch names. The typical top levels are 
"bugfix", "feature", "release". This is how branches are named in large corporation.

But every developer/manager has his own classification on top of those: "currently coded by me", "monitored work of others", "almost done, but shelved for future releases", etc.

SourceTree is the personal tool.
*Please, allow user to create groups of local branches with his/her own tags and to move local branches between these groups.*

PS SourceTree already allows user to group local repositories into logical sets names as user wants these sets to be named. It is a good example.
fields.summary: Logical tree level for local branches

fields.description: As I have multiple projects with multiple repositories each, it would be great if I could group them, like tabs on Chrome.
fields.summary: Group repositories by project

fields.description: Please add the ability to copy text from the file path, which is shown on the right above the diff of changes. This feature can be seen in TortoiseHg as an example. There any text can be selected and copied, it is very convenient and speeds up the work.
fields.summary: Allow current file path text to be selected/copied

fields.description:
There was an argument injection vulnerability in SourceTree for Windows introduced through git-lfs. An attacker could create a malicious repository which, after being cloned in SourceTree for Windows and enabled with git-lfs, is able to exploit this issue to gain code execution on the system. *This is the result of an incomplete fix for CVE-2020-27955*

*Affected versions:*
 * Version 3.4.2 and earlier

 

*Fix*
 * You can download the latest version of the [standard installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourceTreeSetup-3.3.9.exe] or the [enterprise installer|https://product-downloads.atlassian.com/software/sourcetree/windows/ga/SourcetreeEnterpriseSetup_3.3.9.msi].

 

For additional details, see the [full advisory|https://confluence.atlassian.com/display/SOURCETREEKB/SourceTree+for+Windows+Security+Advisory+24th+March+2021]
fields.summary: RCE via git-lfs in Sourcetree for Windows - CVE-2021-21237

fields.description: in the file Listing section (where you can select files tracked, pending, conflicts etc) It would be useful to be able to Sort by Modified Date.
fields.summary: Add option to Sort Files by Modified date

fields.description:
The current Sourcetree version 3.4.3 terminates a running pageant process even though it was not started by Sourcetree.

The corresponding option to start pageant when Sourcetree is started is disabled. The running pageant process should not be touched by Sourcetree if it was not started by Sourcetree itself.

This behavior has not been noticeable in previous versions. This behavior is traceable on two different Windows installations.

Besides, the versions of putty-tools installed with Sourcetree are a bit outdated.

The current version 3.4.3 cannot (yet) be selected for the bugreport.
fields.summary: Sourcetree shuts down foreign pageant process

fields.description:
corresponding option in options is activated

typing any nonsense word as commit message does not rise red wavy highlight

 

it is freshly installed Win 10 machine, the spell checker worked before I reinstalled the system (there was Win 7 updated to 10 earlier)

checked with any recent Source tree version 3.x also with 3.4.3 (which is not yet available on the drop down list below)
fields.summary: spell check of commit messages does not work

fields.description:
It need perl.exe.

perl.exe and other in C:\Program Files\Git\usr\bin

 

 

I try mkdir C:\Program Files\Git\usr\path_bin and set systemPath, and copy file:
 * msys-2.0.dll
 * msys-crypt-0.dll
 * msys-perl5_32.dll
 * perl.exe

it show

 
{code:java}
Can't load '/usr/lib/perl5/vendor_perl/auto/SVN/_Core/_Core.dll' for module SVN::_Core: No such file or directory at /usr/lib/perl5/core_perl/DynaLoader.pm line 193.
 at /usr/lib/perl5/vendor_perl/SVN/Base.pm line 59.
BEGIN failed--compilation aborted at /usr/lib/perl5/vendor_perl/SVN/Core.pm line 5.
Compilation failed in require at /usr/lib/perl5/vendor_perl/SVN/Client.pm line 4.
BEGIN failed--compilation aborted at /usr/lib/perl5/vendor_perl/SVN/Client.pm line 4.
Compilation failed in require at C:\Users\linwc\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.4.2\tools\svn.pl line 2.
BEGIN failed--compilation aborted at C:\Users\linwc\AppData\Local\SourceTree\app-3.4.2\tools\svn.pl line 2.
{code}
fields.summary: support clone SVN in Windows

fields.description:
Sourcetree closes pageant on exit even if it hadn't been started by Sourcetree.

*Issue reproduction:*
 # Make sure that Options->General->'Automatically start SSH agent when Sourcetree opens' option is disabled and close Sourcetree.
 # Start external (=not provided with Sourcetree) pageant instance.
 # Start Sourcetree.
 # Close Sourcetree

_Result:_

Pageant is closed.

_Expected behaviour:_

Sourcetree should not stop pageant if it hadn't been started by Sourcetree. Pageant can be used by other applications.
fields.summary: Sourcetree closes pageant on exit even if it hadn't been started by Sourcetree.

fields.description:
It looks like SourceTree is trying to kill PAgent, but crashes because it doesn't have permissions to kill a PAgent process owned by another user.

 

Steps to reproduce:

1) Windows Login to User A, and launch pagent

2) Fast user switch to User B, who's not an admin

3) Launch SourceTree

4) SourceTree crashes
fields.summary: SourceTree Crashes if launched by a non-admin while another user is running PAgent

fields.description:
bash: /dev/tty: No such device or address error: failed to execute prompt script (exit code 1)bash: /dev/tty: No such device or address error: failed to execute prompt script (exit code 1)

stty: 'standard input': Inappropriate ioctl for device
fields.summary: Unable to checkout to a local branch.

fields.description:
h3. Issue Summary

Sourcetree closes on Cancelling the checking out branch from browser
h3. Steps to Reproduce

1. Go to any Bitbucket repository in browser https://bitbucket.org/
2. Navigate to "Branches"
3. Select any branch
4. Click "Checkout" => "Checkout in sourcetree"
5. Click "Open sourcetree" in browser popup.
6. Click "Cancel" in Sourcetree "URL actions" popup
h3. Expected Results

Application shouldn't close.
h3. Actual Results

Application closes unexpectedly.
h3. Workaround
 Currently there is no known workaround for this behavior. A workaround will be added here when available
fields.summary: Sourcetree closes on Cancelling the checking out branch from browser

fields.description:
When adding a new tag Sourcetree uses the current date on that tag. The tag date is then used by the Github UI for ordering releases. If tags were not added chronologically, the releases are displayed out of sequence. 

This can be avoided by setting GIT_COMMITTER_DATE to the date of the commit before adding the tag. 

I suggest adding this as an option under the Advanced Options of the Tag dialog.
fields.summary: Allow tags to be added using date of commit instead of current date

fields.description: This concerns sourcetree 3.4.2 for Windows 10. No matter how much I try, it remains undetected. The remote toolbar shows a red exclamation mark even after github website has been properly connected with username & password keyed in. Please fix this.
fields.summary: Remote not detected after username & password keyed in

says it all, was posted in 2017 but I can't find anr ref to it being implemented

fields.description: At startup and at various points after that, SourceTree takes 100% disk usage making the system unusable to minutes sometimes. I have reinstalled SourceTree after doing a complete cleanup and that has not helped.
fields.summary: 100% Disk usage
